sentence.Network_en: He was a good man , but always forebear his wrath and complaint.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个老好人,善于克制自我、隐忍无奈.

sentence.Network_en: I had much ado to forebear laughing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我费了很大的劲才忍住笑.

sentence.Network_en: A person from whom one is descended , especially if more remote than a grandparent; a forebear.
sentence.Network_cn: 繁衍后代的人, 特别是远于祖父辈; 前辈.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 创新英语教育的博客 - 创新英语教育 - 网易博客 ... she-bear 母熊 forebear 祖先, 祖宗 bugbear 怪物, 吓人的东西.
同等学力英语词汇和语法考点分析.doc - 豆丁网 ... forearm 前臂 forebears 祖先 forewarn 预先警告.

list.abs: thirteen years after the war , their children meet . the dark past of their forebears threatens to stand in the way of the pair's love for one another .战争结束三十年后，他们的子女相遇了。然而他们父辈的阴暗过去却成了挡在他们爱情道路上的屏障。
consider how much more frugal the poor are than we , how much better they forebear hardship .想想贫困的人比我们节俭多少，他们忍受困境比我们强多少。

despite the constancy of these primal urges , human culture has experienced after upheaval period since our hunter-gatherer forebears roamed the savannas .尽管这些根本的冲动是恒定的，自从我们的狩猎–采集祖先在草原上活动以来，人类文化却经历了一次又一次的大变动。
if sorts 勉强称得上的；各种各样的immediate forebear 直系祖先in a brilliant fan 呈明亮的扇形

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from fore + bear, variant of obsolete beer 'someone who exists' (from be + -er)

example.ex: I'll come back to the land of my forebears.
example.tran: 我将回到祖先的土地上。

means.word_mean: 1. a person from whom you are descended

auth_sentence.content: The music is at times suddenly joyous in a way that's reminiscent of UK forebear Loose Tubes or the Pat Metheny Group.

auth_sentence.content: He does not have the evocative middle-of-the-night gifts of a radio forebear like Jean Shepherd.

sentences.en: Many of us conform to the outdated customs laid down by our forebears.
sentences.cn: 我们许多人都遵循祖先立下的过时习俗。
